generator:
married(Y, X) :- married(X, Y), X != Y.
sibling(C1, C2) :- parent(P, C1), parent(P, C2), C1 != C2.
parent(S, C) :- parent(P, C), married(P, S), S != P.
uncle(U, C) :- parent(P, C), sibling(P, U), male(U).
grandparent(GP, C) :- parent(GP, P), parent(P, C).
grandpa(P) :- grandparent(P, P), male(P).

hard_constraints.description: The marital relationship is defined as a symmetric relation between two distinct individuals; self-marriage is prohibited.
Siblinghood is defined as a relationship between distinct individuals; an individual cannot be their own sibling.
It is required that an individual's gender identification remains consistent such that they are not simultaneously assigned as male and female.
A biological or legal parental relationship cannot be established where the parent and child are the same individual.
